item.title: Severe double dip in road, 10th October
item.description:
There is a ‘double dip’ in road causing a roller coaster effect. It’s been getting steadily worse over last week. Maybe a sinkhole developing?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Replacement tree, 10th October
item.description:
A tree outside 29 abbey wood road, se2 9ed fell approximately 2x years ago and the stumps have now been removed. A replacement tree should be planted to restore the appearance of the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Wood Road, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Street lights not working, 10th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Catford Road, Ladywell, London

item.title: 1-8 Exeter Mansions, Exeter Road, NW2 3UG, 10th October
item.description:
This sofa has been in our front garden porch all day at least. We first saw it early this morning and we’ve been in and out of the building a few times and it’s still there. We’re unaware of where it came from, but we doubt someone living in the building would leave it in the garden and risk damaging it. It’s not the first time we have tents, blankets etc left in the porch by rough sleepers.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Exeter Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street have not been swept or cleaned in months, 10th October
item.description:
The pavement along Woolwich Road has not been cleaned for an extended period. As a result, there is a visible buildup of dirt, litter, and debris. In some areas, leaves and mud have accumulated, creating a slippery and unsightly surface. This is a continuous issue and regular cleaning is required. Please arrange weekly cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light from crack in curb, 10th October
item.description:
There is a hole in the curb and the depth behind is unknown. It is possibly deep. An electrical light shines through the hole. It stems from a subterranean cavity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Holly Mount, West Hampstead, London

item.title: On east side just north on Greencroft Gardens, 10th October
item.description:

item.title: Street light is on during daylight hours., 10th October
item.description:
Street light located in Machell Road at junction with Howbury Road, lamp number 07 standing by the side wall of no.39 Howbury Road, appears wrongly calibrated as it is switched on during daylight hours when other street lights are not switched on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Machell Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
